title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 362-1.2 - Exempt facilities
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 362-1.2 - Exempt facilities

State Regulations

The following facilities are exempt from this

Subpart: (a) A combustion facility
located at and operated by staff of a hospital, residential health care
facility, diagnostic treatment center, or clinical laboratory regulated under
10 NYCRR Part
70
that treats regulated medical waste generated on-site. The
facility can also accept regulated medical waste from a small quantity
generator as defined in Public Health Law, if: (1)
the small quantity generator
self-transports to the facility in accordance with Parts 364 and 365 of this

Title; and
(2)
the combustion
facility and the small quantity generator enter into a written agreement prior
to receipt of waste, copies of which are submitted to the department. (b) Animal crematories, except
those that accept regulated medical waste, regulated pursuant to Part 219 of
this Title. (c) A facility that
combusts a traditional fuel or an alternative fuel unless the fuel is stored at
the facility prior to combustion. (d) A facility or activity that combust solid
wastes that are authorized under 6 NYCRR Section
215.3. Notes
